p: On April 18, 1947, the first documented case of the ZikaV emerged in the Zika forest of Uganda [ 31]. This information only surfaced as the monkey, Rhesus 766 was being observed and studied for research on yellow fever, which is an arbovirus related to the ZikaV [ 24]. Within a year, the virus was isolated from Aedes africanus mosquitoes and serological studies commenced, examining the impact of this virus [ 41].
